required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison Study of Different Tumor Biopsy Method for Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy in Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial of Comparison of Tumor Biopsy Method of Preoperative Vacuum-Assisted, Core Needle Versus Intraoperative Excisional Biopsy for Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy in Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Sentinel lymph node biopsy (SLNB) has become a mainstay surgery method in breast cance, and the identified number of sentinel lymph nodes determines its accuracy for axillary status. Retrospective study indicated that preoperative tumor biopsy results in more detected sentinel lymoh nodes. The clinical trail is designed to compare the effect of three tumor biopsy methods (preoperative vacuum-assisted biopsy, core needle biopsy, and intraoperative excisional biopsy) for sentinel lymph nodes.

detailed_description.textblock:
OBJECTIVES:
Compare the identification rate of sentinel lymph node in breast cancer patients with different tumor biopsy methods.
Evaluate the false-negative rates of sentinel lymph nodes in patients with different tumor biopsy methods.
OUTLINE:
The patients were randomly divided into three group, vacuum-assisted biopsy, core needle biopsy, and intraoperative excisional biopsy. Preoperative vacuum-assisted biopsy and core needle biopsy were performed in 10 days before the final surgery. All patients received dual tracer (radiolabeled colloid and blue dye) guided SLNB.

primary_outcome.measure: Identification rates of sentinel lymph node biopsy
primary_outcome.description: Identification rate of SLNB between three groups

secondary_outcome.measure: Identification numbers of sentinel lymph node biopsy
secondary_outcome.description: Identification numbers of SLNB between three groups

secondary_outcome.measure: fase-negative rates of sentinel lymph node biopsy
secondary_outcome.description: fase-negative rates of SLNB between three groups

arm_group.description: Preoperative vacuum-assisted biopsy was performed within 10 days before final surgery. The tumor were excised almost.
Preoperative core needle biopsy was performed within 10 days before final surgery. The needle biopsy were performed with 3 needles.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- clinically lymph node negative breast cancer patients T1-T3
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of breast cancer locally advanced breast cancer and metastatic breast cancer proven axillary lymph node metastasis history of axillary excisional or incisional biopsy, or dissection history of neoadjuvant chemotherapy pregnancy non-consented patients

results_reference.citation: Yuan C, Wang X, Liu Z, Li C, Bian M, Shan J, Song X, Yu Z, Yu J. Preoperative tumor biopsy results in more detected sentinel nodes than intraoperative biopsy in breast cancer patients. World J Surg Oncol. 2020 Jul 21;18(1):178. doi: 10.1186/s12957-020-01942-4.
